structure.unit: ARTICLE IV. COMMUNITY ANTENNA TELEVISION SYSTEMS

text.section:
Sec. 8A-141. Audit, books and records.
The Licensee hereunder shall maintain books or records of accounts, which shall be annually audited by a certified public accountant, and said audit shall be submitted to the County Manager. The County Manager shall have the right, at any time, at the expense of the County, to cause an audit to be made of the said Licensee, within the public interest.
The Licensee shall file with the Public Works Department true and accurate maps or plats of all existing and proposed installations.
The Licensee shall file annually with the County Manager not later than sixty (60) days after the end of the Licensee's fiscal year a copy of its report to its stockholders, as well as so much of the books of account of the Licensee as are necessary for independent ascertainment of the gross income from operations of the Licensee by the County or its agent.
The Licensee shall keep on file with the County Manager a current list of its shareholders and bondholders, if a corporation. If not a corporation, then a record of the appropriate ownership percentages in the Licensee shall be so filed.
